_meta.purpose: Optimized AI guidance for LD framework generation. Prioritizes machine readability, speed, and strict adherence to core goals. To be used by Gemini.

project.name: ld
project.description: 零虚拟DOM、Signal驱动、完全兼容Vue3和React Hooks的前端框架。

currentState.notes: runtime-core模块已完成，准备开始runtime-dom模块。

codeGenerationRules.NO_UNUSED_VARIABLES: All declared variables MUST be used.
codeGenerationRules.OPTIMAL_LOOPS: In performance-critical hot paths, reverse for-loops (`for (let i = arr.length; i--;)`) MUST be used for unordered iteration. For ordered iteration, array length MUST be cached (`for (let i = 0, len = arr.length; i < len; i++)`). Direct use of `.length` in loop conditions is strictly forbidden in hot paths.
codeGenerationRules.OPTIMAL_ALGORITHMS: All core algorithms MUST be implemented with the lowest possible time and space complexity.

stateManagementProtocol.global: All cross-module shared state (e.g., scheduler, caches) MUST be managed in `packages/reactivity/src/store.ts` within the `globalState` object.
stateManagementProtocol.instance: All component-specific state (e.g., lifecycle hooks, effects) MUST be managed via `createInstanceStore` to ensure isolation.

1_ANALYZE_CODEBASE.description: Analyze existing code to understand context and prevent conflicts.
1_ANALYZE_CODEBASE.purpose: Identify all existing exports and dependencies to ensure new code integrates correctly.

3_GENERATE_CODE.description: Generate the TypeScript code for the target file.

4_UPDATE_MODULE_EXPORTS.description: Update the module's `index.ts` and the main `module.ts` to export new APIs.

5_GENERATE_OR_UPDATE_TESTS.description: Create or update the test file corresponding to the generated code.

6_EXECUTE_TESTS.description: Run tests for the modified file and ensure 100% pass rate.

6a_PERFORMANCE_TUNING.description: After unit tests pass, conduct performance analysis and optimization for the current module.
6a_PERFORMANCE_TUNING.qualityGate: Performance must meet or exceed targets and be competitive with benchmarks (e.g., SolidJS).

lazyLoading.components: All components and routes MUST support code-splitting via dynamic import().
lazyLoading.styles: Compiler MUST output separate CSS files. Runtime MUST dynamically inject styles (via <link> or <style>) on first component mount, ensuring scoped isolation.
lazyLoading.fetchStrategy: Runtime MUST allow custom fetch logic, defaulting to native browser import() or fetch().

compilation.strategy: Hybrid: Use mature parsers, but custom code generators for performance.

exports.rule: Group exports by source file in `index.ts`. List exports individually in `module.ts`.

testing.description: Test runners (`test.mts`, `test-ai.mts`) dynamically select which packages to test based on their status in the main `generate-code-guidance.json` file.

logic.criteria: Only packages with status 'completed' or 'active' are tested.
logic.fallback: If the guidance file is unreadable, all packages (`packages/*`) are tested as a fallback.

qualityGates.performance: All code must be JIT-friendly with minimal GC overhead.
qualityGates.dependencies: Dependency graph must be a DAG (no circular dependencies).
qualityGates.testing: Every new feature or fix must be accompanied by a passing test.
